item.title: Libbydale add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
Libbydale add a quote by Joseph Caldwell
item.description: "Today, Aaron decided, he would begin to grieve in earnest. He would walk the lonely beach, mocked by gulls, uncaring, his every step a stately rebuke to the malign forces that had blighted his fate. His was the tragedy of a man who couldn't have his own way, and he intended to make known his anguish in the solemn solitude that only a stretch of sand, a suspiring sea, and a beetling cliff could provide." -- Joseph Caldwell
